1.text: AND at that time there was raised a great persecution against the church which was at Jerusalem; and they were all dispersed through the countries of Judea, and Samaria, except the apostles.

2.text: And devout men took order for Stephenâ€™s funeral, and made great mourning over him.

3.text: But Saul made havock of the church, entering in from house to house, and dragging away men and women, committed them to prison.

4.text: They therefore that were dispersed, went about preaching the word of God.

5.text: And Philip going down to the city of Samaria, preached Christ unto them.

6.text: And the people with one accord were attentive to those things which were said by Philip, hearing, and seeing the miracles which he did.

7.text: For many of them who had unclean spirits, crying with a loud voice, went out.

8.text: And many, taken with the palsy, and that were lame, were healed.

9.text: There was therefore great joy in that city. Now there was a certain man named Simon, who before had been a magician in that city, seducing the people of Samaria, giving out that he was some great one:

10.text: To whom they all gave ear, from the least to the greatest, saying: This man is the power of God, which is called great.

11.text: And they were attentive to him, because, for a long time, he had bewitched them with his magical practices.

12.text: But when they had believed Philip preaching of the kingdom of God, in the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.

13.text: Then Simon himself believed also; and being baptized, he adhered to Philip. And being astonished, wondered to see the signs and exceeding great miracles which were done.

14.text: Now when the apostles, who were in Jerusalem, had heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent unto them Peter and John.

15.text: Who, when they were come, prayed for them, that they might receive the Holy Ghost.

16.text: For he was not as yet come upon any of them; but they were only baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

17.text: Then they laid their hands upon them, and they received the Holy Ghost.

18.text: And when Simon saw, that by the imposition of the hands of the apostles, the Holy Ghost was given, he offered them money,

19.text: Saying: Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I shall lay my hands, he may receive the Holy Ghost. But Peter said to him:

20.text: Keep thy money to thyself, to perish with thee, because thou hast thought that the gift of God may be purchased with money.

21.text: Thou hast no part nor lot in this matter. For thy heart is not right in the sight of God.

22.text: Do penance therefore for this thy wickedness; and pray to God, that perhaps this thought of thy heart may be forgiven thee.

23.text: For I see thou art in the gall of bitterness, and in the bonds of iniquity.

24.text: Then Simon answering, said: Pray you for me to the Lord, that none of these things which you have spoken may come upon me.

25.text: And they indeed having testified and preached the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem, and preached the gospel to many countries of the Samaritans.

26.text: Now an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip, saying: Arise, go towards the south, to the way that goeth down from Jerusalem into Gaza: this is desert.

27.text: And rising up, he went. And behold a man of Ethiopia, an eunuch, of great authority under Candace the queen of the Ethiopians, who had charge over all her treasures, had come to Jerusalem to adore.

28.text: And he was returning, sitting in this chariot, and reading Isaias the prophet.

29.text: And the Spirit said to Philip: Go near, and join thyself to this chariot.

30.text: And Philip running thither, heard him reading the prophet Isaias. And he said: Thinkest thou that thou understandest what thou readest?

31.text: Who said: And how can I, unless some man shew me? And he desired Philip that he would come up and sit with him.

32.text: And the place of the scripture which he was reading was this: He was led as a sheep to the slaughter; and like a lamb without voice before his shearer, so openeth he not his mouth.

33.text: In humility his judgment was taken away. His generation who shall declare, for his life shall be taken from the earth?

34.text: And the eunuch answering Philip, said: I beseech thee, of whom doth the prophet speak this? of himself, or of some other man?

35.text: Then Philip, opening his mouth, and beginning at this scripture, preached unto him Jesus.

36.text: And as they went on their way, they came to a certain water; and the eunuch said: See, here is water: what doth hinder me from being baptized?

37.text: And Philip said: If thou believest with all thy heart, thou mayest. And he answering, said: I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.

38.text: And he commanded the chariot to stand still; and they went down into the water, both Philip and the eunuch: and he baptized him.

39.text: And when they were come up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord took away Philip; and the eunuch saw him no more. And he went on his way rejoicing.

40.text: But Philip was found in Azotus; and passing through, he preached the gospel to all the cities, till he came to Caesarea.
